alert.note: Alert for Harnett (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 22 at 5:48PM EDT until April 22 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR WESTERN WAYNE...SAMPSON...SOUTHEASTERN HARNETT...EASTERN CUMBERLAND...SOUTHWESTERN WILSON AND JOHNSTON COUNTIES... At 548 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Smithfield to 8 miles east of Benson to 11 miles northwest of Clinton to Jerome to near Elrod, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Smithfield, Clinton, Clayton, Dunn, Benson, Godwin, Micro, Selma, Four Oaks and Pine Level. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
